about: Peterson Hall is named for Robert O. Peterson, an early and generous benefactor of UC San Diego who is known for founding the Jack-In-The-Box restaurant chain in the early 1950s. Peterson Hall contains two large lecture halls that seat 300 to 400 students, serving the instructional needs of the campus and providing a venue for lectures and events open to the outside community.
name: Peterson Hall
